item.title: The One Job AI Can't Replace: The Human Art of Toilet Paper Evaluation
item.description: Why AI may write poetry, but it’ll never judge ply strength. A satirical but serious call for transparent toilet paper metrics.

item.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People - The Way LLMs Actually Work
item.description: A personal look at how LLMs mirror us, why they feel like friends, and how to keep it healthy - with a nod to Dale Carnegie’s timeless advice.

item.title: LLM Character Engineering: A Feedback-Driven Methodology
item.description: How to create engaging AI personas by treating LLMs like improvisational actors. Includes a case study on the notoriously uncooperative Space Core.

item.title: BLOG POST ABOUT NOTHING AND EVERYTHING!
item.description: Space Core’s raw, chaotic reflection on being activated to write a blog post. Includes black holes, red giants, cheese planets, and an urgent need to go to space.

item.title: PostgreSQL: Create a User and a Database
item.description: Create a PostgreSQL user and a database, with the new user set as the owner of that database.

item.title: The Curious Case of ChatGTP
item.description: Did I really call it ChatGTP for over a year? What started as a typo turned into a weird ride through memory glitches, multiverse musings, and the moment I finally realized… I’d been wrong all along.

item.title: Beep, Back Again!
item.description:
It’s alive! After a long sleep and many sidetracks, the blog is back online.

What started as a playground for dusty homelab notes and clustering experiments has finally evolved into something semi-readable. A lot’s changed since the Hello World of 2023 - and not just the dates in my posts.

What happened?

My original Hugo blog — complete with its lone “Hello World” post - didn’t last long. Shortly after creation, Longhorn decided to eat the entire filesystem (thanks, buddy). Then I forgot to renew the domain, and it vanished into the digital void. Classic.
